results.title: The Hot date
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. A put upon adolescent is faced with the unusual problem of potential self-combustion whenever he gets nervous. As a result, his fear is palpable when it comes to his first date. His reluctance is soon overcome as things go well and he decides to invite his love into the bedroom…what happens next is surprising and hilarious!

results.title: The Hot-blooded dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates, Robin Brightwell, WGBH (Boston) and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Challenges our conventional ideas of dinosaurs. Argues that they were not slow-moving, cold blooded reptiles, but were agile, intelligent and hot-blooded. Points out that they didn’t all die out and that their descendants are alive and well and living all around us.

results.title: The Hospital
results.brief_description: Depicts the many departments and services to be found in a hospital. Explains the work of different staff members and illustrates what is involved in diagnosing an illness and caryring out the necessary medical treatment. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Horse whisperer
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert Redford directs himself for the first time in this romantic drama adapted from the best-seller by Nicholas Evans. Teenager Grace and her friend Judith go horseback riding in upstate New York on a winter morning. After a devastating accident, Judith and her horse are killed, while Grace and her horse, Pilgrim, are seriously injured, the frightening incident leaving them both traumatised. Desperate to help, Grace’s mother puts her busy life on hold and travels west with Grace and Pilgrim to see a horse trainer with a special gift. Once there she discovers that his extraordinary gift with horses also touches the lives of those around him. Cast includes Robert Redford, Kristin Scott Thomas, Scarlett Johnasson, Sam Neill, Chris Cooper and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: The Horse thief
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang and Xi'an Film Studio
results.brief_description: Horse Thief is a magnificent saga of survival, filmed on location in Tibet by one of China’s most innovative young directors. The film incorporates images of many of Tibet’s great Buddhist ceremonies and festivals; traditions that were almost eradicated in the “Cultural Revolution”, but which are now again observed as they have been for hundreds of years. The film neither endorses nor attacks Buddhist philosophy, but it does offer the most respectful view of Tibetan culture yet seen in Han Chinese art. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Horse in the gray flannel suit
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Winston Hibler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An advertising executive under pressure to come up with a winning campaign uses, for inspiration, his daughter’s love of horses. This children’s film, centred on horses and equestrian pursuits, is a family-oriented comedy that stars Dean Jones, Fred Bolton, Diane Baker, Lloyd Bochner, Fred Clark and Ellen Janov.

results.title: The Horse and its relatives
results.creator_credit: Chicago Zoological Society and Coronet Productions
results.brief_description: The horse and has been tamed and used by humans since the days of antiquity. In this film several of the animals b iologically related to the horse are studied, with emphasis on their physical characteristics and their habits in their natural surroundings - the zebra, the South American tapir, and the rhinoceros. These animals are very rarely tamed. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.

results.title: The Horror of it all
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Traces the history and development of the horror film from the beginning of the century up to the 1970’s. The film combines fascinating and rare footage from European and American horror films with a look at changes and recurring themes in these works. Narrated by Jose Ferrer.

results.title: The Horn. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Ifor James explains the complexities of the modern double horn and its use in the modern symphony orchestra. The part played by the horn in chamber music is also illustrated and tribute paid to Dennis Brain, who is heard playing an excerpt from the Beethoven Horn Sonata.

results.title: The Horn. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Ifor James demonstrates the evolution of the horn from the old hunting horn of nearly 300 years ago, through each stage of its development to the orchestral horn and the modern valve horn, which is capable of rapid changes in key called for by contemporary composers. Illustrated with excerpts from Handel, Mozart and Weber.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Ifor James demonstrates the evolution of the horn from the old hunting horn of nearly 300 years ago, through each stage of its development to the orchestral horn and the modern valve horn, which is capable of rapid changes in key called for by contemporary composers. Illustrated with excerpts from Handel, Mozart and Weber.
